stem: The unit manager is reviewing four complex cases. Based on the documentation, match each barrier to discharge with the most appropriate interdisciplinary professional to resolve the issue.

tabs.title: Patient Information
tabs.content:
Patient A: Homeless, no local address for home oxygen delivery.
Patient B: Medically stable, family disagrees on discharge location, no Power of Attorney (POA).
Patient C: Requires specialized bariatric bed and hoyer lift at home, insurance denied request.
Patient D: Non-English speaker, refuses life-saving blood transfusion due to religious beliefs.

tabs.title: Available Services
tabs.content:
Social Work: Community resources, housing, financial aid.
Case Management: Insurance liaison, DME coordination, utilization review.
Ethics Committee: Complex values conflicts, end-of-life disagreements.
Interpreter Services: Language bridge, cultural mediation, chaplaincy services.

rows.text: Housing instability and lack of resources

rationale.correct: Social Work (r1) addresses housing and community resource needs (c1). Case Management (r2) manages insurance and DME coordination (c2). The Ethics Committee (r3) resolves value conflicts and legal decision-making impasses (c3). Interpreter/Chaplain services (r4) address language and religious barriers (c4).
clinicalPearls: Case Managers handle insurance, equipment, and financial aspects.
Social Workers address housing, community resources, and social support.
Ethics Committee addresses complex ethical dilemmas and conflicts.

questionTrap.trap: Referring a patient with DME needs to Social Work.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: DME issues are primarily handled by Case Management, not Social Work.

mnemonic.title: Interdisciplinary Team Roles
mnemonic.expansion: SW (Social support), CM (Cost management), Ethics (Ethical dilemmas).
